suite.name: AutoItLibrary Windows Calculator
Calculator Test Cases

kw.name: Start Calculator
kw.doc: Start the Windows Calculator application and set the default settings that the rest of the tests expect.

kw.name: Run
kw.doc: Direct wrapper for AutoIt's Run method.

kw.name: Wait For Active Window
kw.doc: Wait up to _TimeOut_ seconds for the window with the given _WindowTitle_ and optional

kw.name: Get Calculator Version
kw.doc: Get the version of the Windows Calculator. Version 5.1 is WinXP, Version 6.1 is Win7.

kw.name: Send
kw.doc: method Send

kw.name: Sleep
kw.doc: Pauses the test executed for the given time.

kw.name: Send
kw.doc: method Send

kw.name: Win Wait Active
kw.doc: Direct wrapper for AutoIt's WinWaitActive method.

kw.name: Run Keyword If
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with the given arguments, if ``condition`` is true.

kw.name: Control Get Text

kw.doc: Sets variable based on the given condition.

kw.name: Set Suite Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current suite.
kw.msg: ${MENUMAP} = {'View Standard': 'VT', 'View Scientific': 'VS', 'View Decimal': 'VD', 'View Hex': 'VP', 'View Digit grouping': 'VI', 'Edit Copy': 'EC', 'Edit Paste': 'EP', 'Exit': '{F4}'}

kw.doc: The Windows Calculator application doesn't really use a Windows GUI Menu to implement its menus.

kw.name: Comment
kw.doc: Displays the given messages in the log file as keyword arguments.

arguments.arg: We want "Digit Grouping" off but there's no way to examine the check beside the menu item.
So we need to try recognizing some displayed digits to see if its on or off and then change it if necessary.

suite.doc: Tests the AutoItLibrary by using various AutoIt keywords on the GUI of the Windows Calculator application.
Post installation self-test for AutoItLibrary. Also serves as an example of some GUI automation techniques that can be used when automation Windows GUI tests.
